page.title: 07Manchester Ship Canal
page.content: In{1896}the Manchester Ship Canal was finished and it was opened by Queen Victoria.The cotton merchants provided enough money to build it, but over the years it became cheaper to send the cotton from{Liverpool to Manchester}by road,and finally they could buy it more cheaply abroad,so the amount of traffic has decreased. These days there is only one ship which sails down the canal and that is the sewerage ship.The canal is now very polluted and few fish can survive.The builders said that the canal would last for hundreds of years but that will never happen as the{Manchester {Ship Canal Company}are thinking of closing the canal by 1990.
